titleStmt.title: The wofull lamentation of Edward Smith, a poore penitent prisoner in the iayle of Bedford, which he wrote a short time before his death. To the tune of, Daintie come thou to me.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assignes of Thomas Symcock.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by STC.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
